revised_title: Hydropical Case: Unusual Distension of the Gall Bladder
tldr: The author presents a case study of a patient suffering from hydropical case, where the gall bladder was unusually distended. The patient experienced a dropsey ascites, leading to frequent water retention. Despite various treatments, the patient eventually passed away. The post-mortem examination revealed a distended gall bladder, which had torn the liver apart. The case highlights the complexities of medical conditions and the importance of further research in understanding and treating such cases.
